page.title: 02URBAN RENEWAL
page.content: Edinburgh now has an active policy of not building on the Green Belt surrounding the city. More housing is constantly required, therefore urban infilling on gap sites takes place throughout Edinburgh. Within our sector Cala Homes built new flats in Spylaw Road, having demolished Gillsland Park School for boys. The same firm also built 32, 2-bedroom flats in Craighouse Road on ground which was used as playing fields by George Watsons College. Sixty-five 1 and 2 bedroom flats have been built by Wimpey homes on wasteland on the corner of Polwarth Terrace and Grays Loan. Also sixty retirement flats have been erected by Barrett builders in the garden surrounding a large house which itself has been renovated and divided into flats.{
